Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou? Do we have new orders?
Apparently, Command is wondering if it should be "Captain."
I don't understand.
Sorry. Gossip from the Neutrality Fleet. The idea is that commanding officers would be referred to as "Captain," or something phonetically close, to avoid confusion amongst international crews.
... But you are "Kanchou."

Fields.MenuText: It's supposed to be for comprehension.
For what it's worth, I don't expect this particular idea to catch on. It's not popular.
If "Kanchou" is what you prefer, we can stick with it regardless. The non-Japanese crew will figure it out.

Fields.DialogueText: Kappu... tan. Understood. English is not my first language. You have my most sincere apologies.
I will follow orders when they come. If everyone is to use "Kappu-tan," I will do so.
Worry about that when it happens.
If you insist - thank you, Kanchou. But... the Funayūrei...
I have to start paying attention to the horizons more often...
@BATTLE
Upwards of thirty percent of the crew is non-Japanese, and the Japanese crew members *do* generally recognize "Captain."
Ah... the alarms are ringing...
Yes, let's get on-
Chotto matte kudasai, Kanchou.
Fubuki, why are you still sitting?
Shh....
Fu-
Meditation, no matter how inconvenient, helps to slow us down. It helps us focus on the problems at hand, Kanchou.
Do you not sense it? Energies of... discord. Kaosu. Why is that present among our crew?

Fields.MenuText: Because there are Morganas surrounding us?
The crew have their own varied emotions and feelings. We have no control over them.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. Those energies are as regular as the winds, but...
Perhaps, but there is something mixed in the idle chatters of our crew.... but, what that is, I do not know.
There is more that needs to be found within my meditation...
We'll discuss this later, Fubuki. I have to be on deck at least.
I will join you momentarily, Kanchou.
What is going on out there?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Kanchou... Ano, Kappa-tain? Heh...
What's so funny, Fubuki?
Unintentionally, I have made a pun. "Kappa-tain."
A kappa is a water imp-like creature in Japanese folklore. Webbed at the feet, it can remind one of a frog-like man.
Various accounts differ on the appearance, but all of them have something in common. They can be sinister and kidnap, murder, and mutilate children and women.
I'm not an imp, nor do I kidnap people, if that's what you're implying, Fubuki!
Gomen-ne. Apologies. But you do live on the water, do you not?
And I suppose Funayūrei are somewhat like kappa, as well.
That would seem a little more reasonable.
Both entities "kidnap" and murder others and drag them to the bottom of abyssal waters. It's rather... gruesome.

Fields.MenuText: Do you sense something strange again?

Fields.DialogueText: Gomennasai.
Ah, there is nothing wrong, Kap-tain...?
Ah, nothing... "strange".
I do wonder if HMS Ark Royal would enjoy what I have said.
You can worry about that later, Morganas are approaching.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Funayūrei...
They will not outspeed me for long.
@BATTLE
Cold... Miyuki... Yuki...
Fubuki?
Ah... Kanchou....
What are you doing here on deck? The battle is over.
Hai. I am aware. The gentle breeze after a harsh storm is lovely, do you not think so? I was reminiscing over my past.

Fields.MenuText: You can't reminisce inside the ship?

Fields.DialogueText: There are many things about my past I would like to share with you, Kanchou. Yet, you must be patient, as rainfall fills an urn.
But where is the joy of reminiscing inside, when you can feel the cool, soft breeze that harkens to simpler times?
My past is not a story that should be found entertaining.
I'm sorry, I may have been a little insensitive with my choice of words.
Oh...
It still pains me to think of her sometimes, but I must look at the good things and joys we shared together.
We used to hear news of Hokkaido in the winter and communicate what we would see at port, were we nearby.
You were close to Miyuki.
Hai... We were...
Fubuki... I...
I need to be alone, Kanchou. Please excuse me...
I could have been a little warmer, I suppose...
Kanchou, a word with you please? The strategies you have imple-
Fubuki... about before...
Please do not concern yourself over the past. You have felt embarrassment over your actions. That is understandable, but do not desire to be forgiven by others.
But...
If you constantly seek the approval of others, happiness will not come to you in this life. Think of changing your desires in a way that will lead you to enlightenment.
Good.
To be awakened, fully aware of reality. Releasing yourself from this suffering.
Knowledge comes to those who pursue enlightenment earnestly.
Now, what I wanted to talk to you about was...
No time, Morganas are approaching.
... about the matter of offensive strikes...
@BATTLE
Fubuki, may I ask a question?
Hai, Kanchou.
Are you by any chance a Buddhist?
Yes, I am.
What made you decide upon Buddhism?
It was not that I "made" the decision. It was more of what I found to be the truth to me.
That makes sense.
This world... is full of carnage. Peace, finding oneself among the chaos, helping others... Buddhism walks a different path than what the world has succumbed to.
What about the others? Do you have a problem with those who don't walk the Buddhist path?
No. People choose their own path, like I have done for myself. What good would forcing a religion on someone do?
That's a valid concern.
Is it my turn to ask a question, Kanchou?
Certainly.
Does it matter to you that this is the path I have chosen?

Fields.MenuText: Your life is yours, Fubuki. Who am I to have a problem with it?

Fields.DialogueText: I am delighted to hear so.
Tolerance toward others... the makings of a true kanchou.
Arigato. You are too kind, Kanchou.
Oh, and Fubuki...
Funayūrei...
Impeccable timing...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, may I have your approval on--
Morganas are on the horizon! Yes to whatever you have to say. Let's get a move on.
But...
It can wait, Fubuki!
@BATTLE
Fubuki, we have... Wha?! What is that in your lap?
Konichiwa, Kanchou. How may I be of service?
You can start by telling me what that bundle of fluff on sticks is.
Bundle of fluff on sticks? A red-crowned crane. One of the many beautiful animals in this world.
The speck of red that peeks from its black and white feathers has an essence of wabi-sabi.
But why is it on this ship?!
She landed on my lap back in port and has not left me since. I was going to ask for your approval on the matter before the Funayūrei arrived, and you said "Yes."
But...
Shh... Usagi is sleeping.

Fields.MenuText: I don't care! We can't have animals on the ship!

Fields.DialogueText: Be polite to Usagi-san!
... There, there, Usagi.
Because Usagi is a crane.
"Usagi"?
Usagi means "rabbit" or "bunny" in your language.
Wait, you named a crane rabbit?
Hai. When she is sleeping, she reminds me of a little bunny.
I trust you have no problems with this, Kanchou. After all, an integral part of being in command of Nagano no Kamis and crew members is keeping them content.
Any disagreements we may have had will be forgiven if you let me keep Usagi-san.
Fine, Fubuki. You can keep Usagi since I did, unknowingly, agree to this.
Arigatō.
*a huge bird squawks*
Fubuki, you look pale. Is something the matter?
We will converse later. Funayūrei...
@BATTLE
Are you all right now, Fubuki?
No...
So, what is troubling you, Fubuki?
The four noble truths cannot even quell this pain in my heart...
Fubuki?
Did I tell you how Miyuki died?
You did not.
Inazuma, another of my sisters, killed Miyuki.
What? How can that...
It was an accident. Inazuma crashed and drowned poor Miyuki outside of Cheju.
This was before the war started?
Hai. Inazuma had no control over what happened, but she expresses great remorse over Miyuki's death, and I cannot blame her.

Fields.MenuText: Losing family members is always... difficult.
Perhaps we could find Inazuma, and comfort her?

Fields.DialogueText: Indeed, it is. Inazuma fell into a deep depression, and has not been the same since.
That is impossible. Inazuma has not awoken as a Belle, but I can understand her thoughts and feelings. After she realized what she had done, she fell into a great depression.
Arigatō, Kanchou. Inazuma became very depressed following the accident. The pain, sorrow, and guilt eat at her. My own guidance sometimes does not quench the agony.
I am thankful that I still have Inazuma after that accident but.... I miss Miyuki dearly...
Fubuki...
Gomen-ne. Miyuki was younger than me, but she had more enthusiasm than I do and would be mad if I dwelled on her death. Usagi-san needs some attention. If you will excuse me...
Keep fighting, Fubuki...
Fubuki? Fubuk... Wha?! Usagi! Get off of my head! Not the eyes!
Kanchou! I heard screaming. What is the matter?
Urk... the.. bird...
Usagi-san wanted to say hello to you before I arrived. Come here, Usagi-san.

Fields.MenuText: Did she just try to mate with me?
I'm quite sure that was not a hello...
What if she wanted to kill me?!

Fields.DialogueText: I am certain that she was just trying to greet you.
Her claws are soft, and she merely was patting you on the head.
Usagi-san would not hurt anyone without reason.
Anyway, you called upon me, Kanchou.
Yes, I did. Do you have the strategies for our next attack?
Hai, Kanchou. Here they are.
Thanks... Please keep Usagi away from my head. Greeting or not...
Usagi-san... please don't hurt Kanchou again.
@BATTLE
*Usagi honks and flaps her huge wings*
*ALARM*
Hmmm...
Fubuki, what's wrong?
Something... is not right with the crew.
What do you mean?
I overheard a crew member's conversation. One of them was shaken. He said he spotted a ship that looked nearly identical to mine.
Why is that so odd?
118.4 meters... traveled at 38 knots...
Fubuki, we have Morganas coming in! Worry about this later, please!...
Very well, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
I'm sorry, Fubuki, do you have-
... Six Type 3 127 mm 50 caliber naval guns, twenty-two Type 96 25 mm AT/AA guns, ten 13 mm AA guns, nine 610 mm torpedo tubes, and thirty-six depth charges.
Identical to me, Kanchou.
Fubuki, you're not making sense. What are you thinking?
Kanchou, the report that came in was identical to Miyuki... my sister.
Wait, are you sure? You have several other sisters, Fubuki.
But what if it is Miyuki? What do I do then?

Fields.MenuText: We need to think this over before we act.
You have to be 100% sure that it is Miyuki before we can jump to conclusions.

Fields.DialogueText: I do not know either, Kanchou...
We do not have time!
Miyuki could be out there, Kanchou!
Fubuki, listen. We all need to calm down.
No! We need to find her, now!
What on earth is going on?
Scour the entire eastern edge, everyone! We have to be on the lookout for any ships that look like Fubuki. Do I make myself clear?
Yes, Captain!
Usagi-san...
I see Usagi-san is getting her daily treat.
Yes, she is, Kanchou.
You still seem distressed, Fubuki.
I'll admit to feeling some sense of despair.
Is this about Miyuki?
Hai, Kanchou. Even if we do find her, I do not know what our next course of action will be.
You have a lot of time to think before we even find her, Fubuki. No decision has to be made right now. And we're not even sure that it is Miyuki.
Hai...

Fields.MenuText: You'll do the right thing, no matter what you decide, Fubuki.
It's going to be all right.

Fields.DialogueText: If only snow would descend on this sorrowful day...
If it is Miyuki, I wonder if she's in pain... How does one feel after rising from the ocean floor?
If my sister is out there, any decisions I make could affect her as well.
Gomen-ne. I am emotional right now. This is... unlike me.
Yes, Fubuki. What would you say if, the next time you're meditating, I take care of Usagi?
You would?!
... Sure...
This news is as pleasant as a crane's dance. Thank you, Kanchou. I will inform Usagi!
Later. Morganas are here.
Usagi-san still needs to be accounted for, Kanchou.
Sure thing, Fubuki.
@BATTLE
Kanchou.
Fubuki, what might I do for you today?
*sweeps paperwork off the desk onto the floor*... There.
Huh? Why did you dump my papers all over the deck?!
Beauty is in forms you least expect, Kanchou. The essence of wabi-sabi is before your eyes. Ah... the cacophony of sirens. Let us depart.
But the documents...
@BATTLE
Fubuki, I love having you around. However, throwing documents on the floor does not help. What was that about?
Wabi-sabi. Finding beauty in the imperfect around us. It is how I live my life and adjust to events not going as planned.
And knocking my documents is supposed to help that?
Hai, Kanchou. When was the last time you truly thought about finding beauty in things that are, to society, ugly or wrong?
I haven't thought of it.
This is why we are having this discussion now. War is all about wabi-sabi. Funayūrei. Summer. All perfect examples.
Are you telling me there is beauty in the Morganas too?
Yes and no. They fight for what they feel they must. The destruction of innocent lives is disgusting, but their resolve is beautiful in itself.
My thoughts and beliefs can be seen as wabi-sabi as well.
Unforgivable, I am aware, Kanchou. You are missing my argument.
This conversation can be difficult to understand, like water freezing into snow.
I really don't get it. I'm sorry, Fubuki.
In other words, Kanchou... if my sister is one of them now, if she is a Funayūrei... I want to see the beauty of what she has become.
Fubuki...
Ugh... why is it freezing down in the cargo bay? Hello?
Oh, Kanchou. What brings you down here?
I was walking around and saw a sign outside the cargo bay that I haven't seen before.
I wrote that sign, Kanchou. "Fubuki's Farm" sounds quaint, doesn't it?
Wait, what?
Belles cannot travel far from our ships, so there are many things we cannot do. One of the crew members was talking about a farm his mother tended.
This gave me an idea to raise vegetables that are suited for the winter. I would never miss the weather when I am down here, Kanchou.
Here is some daikon, mitsuba, shiso, myoga....

Fields.MenuText: Where did you get the supplies?

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou.
The same crew member kindly found me some pots, dirt, and seeds. He said I did not have to pay him back for any of the equipment.
A type of pink ginger bud that is good either pickled or in miso soup.
If we raise enough vegetables, we can give them out to the people at the ports.
Wait, are you sure?
If I have the energy to not be burdened by my earthly worries, I will gladly help those in need.
Fubuki, I...
Funayūrei... We will force them to disperse before they threaten Usagi or the vegetables.
@BATTLE
Fubuki, can we talk?
Īe. Funayūrei have crept upon us.
Perhaps taking cover in the pleasant shade of the clouds.
@BATTLE
What were you about to say, Kanchou?
I'm hoping I earned your trust a little more now that I have granted Usagi asylum here on the ship. I was wondering if I may know a bit of your thought process.
Thought process?
I noticed in battle you tend to neglect your defense and focus all your energy into achieving a fatal shot. Why is that?
In Buddhism, it is stated in the five precepts to never take a life. I take no joy in killing, Kanchou. No one should.
But, we are at war, where death is encouraged. We need to put the Funayūrei out of their misery as quickly as possible.
I am glad to hear you do.
Heh, hai.
Nothing in this life will be easy, Kanchou.
Maybe Miyuki will have a swift death by my hand...
We still don't know if it really is Miyuki. Remember, we need proof. This is not a time to jump to conclusions.
... Hai, Kanchou.
Kanchou. My favor has now arrived.
Your... favor?
You told me you would look after Usagi while I meditate. Today is the day you uphold your favor.

Fields.MenuText: ... I'm delighted to look after the crane that nearly pecked out my eyeballs.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. Thank you for understanding and upholding your favor. I will be at the farm if you need me, Kanchou.
Here is Usagi!
I knew you would be, Kanchou. Responsible and disciplined. Good traits that are needed to look after Usagi-san.
She eats reeds and grass, which I have provided for you in this basket. Oh, and there are fish in the very back of the freezer behind the natto. I depart now, Kanchou.
Fu... Fu...
*Usagi stares at the Captain*
*Usagi lets loose a loud HONK!*
Uagh! Please! Not the eyes again! What about reeds?!
*Usagi honks urgently*
Ow, ow, ow... Okay! Phew...
*Usagi climbs onto the Captain's head*
Resting on my head is better than being blind, I suppose. Back to work...
@BATTLE
*Usagi flaps her wings*
*ALARM*
Arigatō, Funayūrei, for there is no rest for the children of the snow!
Nicely put... but I hope we can prove that wrong.
@BATTLE
Fubuki, look!
Hm?
One of the crew members gave me his pictures of Hokkaido in the winter. I want you to have them.
Ah...
Does... this make you happy?
Kanchou... this brings a nostalgic warmth to my heart. Thank you.
I know your name means "blizzard," but why do you love the snow?
What do you hear in the summer?
Crickets tend to occur most seasons, but yes, they are a part of summer.
Children laughing... Hai...
Ah, quintessential to summer. I am rather fond of those insects.
Summer is filled with noise and life. Silence is not prevalent. It is not appreciated in the modern world.
Winter provides a solitude, a solemn reflection upon a chilly lake. And in winter, a lot of happy memories are made from being around friends and family.
Winter... There is a peaceful serenity to be had that cannot be had with any other season.
But... the snow does melt.
Isn't it like wabi-sabi?
Hm?
The season is not perfect. There is death among crops, famine, and the unbearable cold...
Winter has a deep, profound beauty... right?
Hai...
Where was the ship last seen?
Several hours ago, Fubuki.
So we missed it earlier on in the day...
No sign of Miy-- No sign of the ship we're looking for?
Īe, Kanchou. No sign.

Fields.MenuText: But we seem to be closer and closer to finding it.
We'll find the ship. Wherever it is.
Do you have any proof it's Miyuki since we last discussed?

Fields.DialogueText: True. I wonder how long we are going to keep missing it.
Will we be too late? The winds will determine that.
No...
My snowflake hairpin - it was hers, before she drowned. I am not one bound much by earthly possessions, but Miyuki's belongings grow dearer to my heart each day.
I was curious why you treated that hairpin with such respect.
Miyuki was more boyish than I was. She received it as a gift, and felt compelled to wear it, even though doing so made her squirm.
I'm sorry, but that is funny to imagine.
Do not apologize. I am rather fond of that memory myself, heh.
Kanchou, I am curious...
Sorry, Fubuki. It'll have to wait. Morganas are coming in fast.
Hai, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
*Usagi squawks and flaps her wings*
Hai, hai! Usagi-san, you have a big appetite today. Look! The crew brought in a big basket full of mackerel for you!
Fubuki! There you are.
Konichiwa, Kanchou. Would you care to help me harvest the daikon today?
The daikon is ready this fast? In this environment?
Do you remember that crew member that tended his okaasan's farm? He provided me with secret growing techniques that enable a faster growing time. Especially in an indoor area.
Is that so? I'll be glad to help you harvest!
Please be careful, though. Daikon are delicate.

Fields.MenuText: Is this the first time you've felt soil beneath your fingers, Fubuki?
I understand. Do you have any advice on getting them out carefully?

Fields.DialogueText: I knew I could rely on you, Kanchou.
Hai. I can say with a certainty that I am feeling excitement and joy. The soil has a luxurious texture with bits of rough gravel mixed in between. A marvelous experience.
Pull them from the base of the plant and gently loosen the dirt around the root.
... Hnghhh, this one really dug its roots in tight.
Pull harder. Here, let me hold your right hand around the root. Now pull!
Augh!
*CRASH*
Ah! We might have both fallen over, but the daikon is one piece. Thank you, Kanchou. That was the last of them, actually.
Why do I get a sinking feeling you had no confidence I would be able to harvest the rest?
Would you have been able to, if given the opportunity?
The alarms... Let us get to the bridge.
Yeah.
@BATTLE
Sightings of the ship have been confirmed, Fubuki!
All right, get us in closer!
Yes, Fubuki.
Are we going to pull through?
Optimism, not pessimism, Kanchou!
What's that?
Kuso! The Funayūrei blocked our path to Miyuki!

Fields.MenuText: We still don't know if that's Miyuki.

Fields.DialogueText: I cannot! Not when she is within our grasp.
I feel that it is her, Kanchou!
You can't be sure of that!
All hands to battle stations! We are pushing Funayūrei aside! Come at me if you dare...
@BATTLE
*Usagi makes a plaintive little honk*
Hey, Usagi. Fubuki, talk to me.
Kanchou...
I'm sorry we couldn't catch up to the ship.
You are not at fault, Kanchou. I must apologize to you concerning my actions earlier.
You were overwhelmed by the desire to find your sister. I understand. Don't worry about it.
Arigatō. We are closer and closer every time to seeing her. Why? Why does she keep escaping our grasp?

Fields.MenuText: What if she doesn't want to be found?
Could the Morganas be preventing her from being with us?

Fields.DialogueText: She is my sister, Kanchou. Miyuki would want to be found...
That could be a possibility. But if that really is her, why did she not call out to me?
Hai... I hope so, Kanchou.
I have been thinking though. Would finding Miyuki really make you happy?
Of course! She is my blood!
I want you to think about what I said, and about what you've said in the past.
... Kanchou? Alarms... Kuso.
@BATTLE
**ALARM**
Fubuki?
*Usagi lets out a "Hakaw!"*
Whoa! Easy, Usagi.
*Usagi watches the Captain*
... I'm guessing Fubuki is meditating, and I shouldn't disturb her?
No, I just finished my meditation, Kanchou.
Ah! Was it a fruitful meditation?
Hai. I was thinking about what you said. It will take me more time to decipher the meaning. I will know the answer in due course.
I do not give up on challenges easily, Kanchou.
Arigatō, Kanchou. Spring has blossomed in my heart, yet I do not mind.
I will, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Imagawayaki... on board...
What's wrong?
Someone on shore brought... Imagawayaki. Luscious sweet pastry around a sticky filling of red bean...
Isn't that "Dorayaki"?
Īe. Dorayaki is made so that pancakes loosely sandwich around red bean.
Imagawayaki, which can have many different fillings, is more condensed than a Dorayaki and is made in a special welled pan.

Fields.MenuText: If the crew members have some, go get it!
Sounds delicious. Can you make it?
What other fillings can you put in it?

Fields.DialogueText: I would but... I am not so sure if I should rob another crew member's valuable sweets.
No, sadly, I am not skilled in cooking.
It varies, but you can put in custard, chocolate, curry, or other savory fillings.
Anyway, it would be rude to ask for a piece...
Hey, would you mind sharing some imagawayaki with Fubuki and me?
Sure, Captain!
But...!
Didn't you say that Buddhism draws you down a path to help others?
Yes, but...
This is my way of helping you. It's the least I can do, Fubuki. Oh, and here you go, Usagi...
*Usagi gulps down a bite and honks*
Hey, she seemed to enjoy it! Eat your share too, Fubuki, before... augh... the Morganas show up.
Usagi-san, keep these safe. I have some torpedoes to share with these Funayūrei ...
@BATTLE
Unleash the battle cry, Usagi-san! They will not destroy the cargo while we are alive!
*Usagi belts out an energetic honk*
@BATTLE
Hai. That is the last of the shiso. Thank you again for helping me box up my produce, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Does that mean I can finally stop?

Fields.DialogueText: Usagi-san wants to thank you too!
Hai. And look! Usagi-san came to say hello!
No, Usagi-san! Kanchou is not food!
... Hi again, Usagi-san...
Heh...
Are you really not going to taste any of the produce you've grown before you give it away?
Hai. Miyuki would want that too. It is imperative to have resources given back to the civilians as soon as they are available. Funayūrei have not been kind to their food supplies.
And... the harvest of these crops is an essence of wabi-sabi as well. Taking the lives of hundreds of plants for the nourishment of others.
You're an amazing person, Fubuki.
Not yet, but perhaps someday. I hope I will be someone you can look at with pride.
Heh, I already do, Fubuki.
Usagi-san! Sound the horagai! Let the Funayūrei hear our war-cry!
*Usagi blasts a dignified, urgent honk*
@BATTLE
Ow, ow. Hi, Usagi-san... Fubuki, what was that noise I heard before the battle?
The horagai, Kanchou. It is an important instrument in Buddhism and in war, depending on the tone.
In reality, I was hoping to draw Miyuki towards us... that it might have awoken a part of her heart.

Fields.MenuText: What about what I said to you before?

Fields.DialogueText: I want to believe, Kanchou.
I know, Kanchou.
Gomen-ne.
It was my last effort to reach out to Miyuki. There is nothing left to try, Kanchou, as long as she keeps running from me.
Fubuki...
I need some time alone, if you do not mind.
If you need me, you know where to find me. Right, Fubuki?
Hai...
Kanchou.
Fubuki? Are you all right?
I am... all right. I have made a decision about Miyuki, Kanchou.
Oh? What have you decided?
Miyuki would not want her death to linger among the sea and winds. If she is out there, I will not hesitate to put her to rest.
That she should be resurrected or have her memory disgraced is... horrendous.
But if Miyuki is brought back to life and calls out to you, won't you hesitate?
Honestly? No. Miyuki was hardheaded and would want the job to be done thoroughly and swiftly. There is no room for overflowing emotions on the battlefield.
That is why we are giving up the chase of Miyuki. Chasing her now is like trying to follow one snowflake among a blizzard.
If nothing else, once the other Funayūrei are eliminated, we will try to find Miyuki again. If she is still being influenced by them, her rest will at last occur.
Kanchou, will you walk alongside me as my support?

Fields.MenuText: You're my friend, Fubuki. I'll never abandon you.
You mean so much to me, Fubuki. I don't envision myself ever leaving you.

Fields.DialogueText: I am glad to hear so, Kanchou.
Arigatō.
I am guessing Usagi-san still stays, though...
Certainly. I am theorizing that Usagi-san could be Miyuki, should her ship be devoid of her soul.
Wait, you mean, reincarnated?
It is only a theory, Kanchou. However it would explain the energy Usagi-san has.
Yeah... well, if she is Miyuki, welcome aboard? Any sister... or pet... of Fubuki's has a home here.
*Usagi squawks and flaps her wings*
Haha! How nice Kanchou is to you, Usagi-san!
